title: 中国剩余定理1（Chinese remainder theorem）

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we add three more soldiers, it will become: "there's nothing left in a group of 4,5,7""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4\times5\times7=140"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfies the above. Subtract by 3 and get the answer=137"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1 coin worth more than 2 bias coin.
1-D
1-D, 2-D simultaneously!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Two bodies were thrown simultaneously from same point. One straight up and other at an angle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"60^\\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the horizontal. Initial velocity is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25\\text{ m/s}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for each body. Find the distance between the two bodies after 1.7 seconds."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Round off your answer to the nearest integer."}]}]}

title: 1D Action
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A particle of mass "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" travels along a one-dimensional path from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = L"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the following velocity:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v(t) = v_0 + \alpha \sin(2 \pi t / T) \\
T = \frac{L}{v_0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Regardless of the particular value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the particle starts at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_1, t_1) = (0,0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ends at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_2, t_2) = (L,T)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Since there is no potential, the action for this path as a function of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S(\alpha) = \int_0^T \frac{1}{2}  m \, v^2(t) \, dt = v_0^a \, T + \alpha^b \, \frac{T}{c} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the above expression, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers.  What is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a + b + c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Bonus:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" Which one of Newton's Laws does this result relate to?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Karan Chatrath"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/karan-at644y/"}]},{"type":"text","text":" has shown how to derive the result.  I will comment on the physical significance a bit more.  When I form these kinds of problems, I use the following procedure:  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" Start with a standard physical trajectory, where a particle moves from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_1, t_1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_2, t_2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"text","text":"2)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" Deform the trajectory in such a way that the end points in space and time remain the same.  This is usually done by adding some extra term with a "deformation parameter" ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", in this case)  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can take any value, there are infinitely many conceivable paths with the same end points in space and time.  But the vast majority of these are non-physical, and would never happen in reality.  The physical paths correspond to:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{d S}{d \alpha} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying this to the action for this problem yields:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{d S}{d \alpha} = \alpha T = 0 \implies \alpha = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This means the velocity has the form:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v(t) = v_0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the absence of a potential (force), the physical path is the one that has constant velocity.  So the principle of stationary action yields Newton's 1st law."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            @Steven Chase I was solving your latest problem. Just tell me one thing please. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If the total current through resistor be I then, what is the initial value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{dI}{dt}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Please.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S(\alpha) = \int_{0}^{T} \left(v_o + \alpha \sin\left(\frac{2 \pi t}{T}\right)\right)^2 \ dt"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
The above is a straightforward evaluation which leads to the answer:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S(\alpha) = v_o^2T + \alpha^2\frac{T}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I find this situation paradoxical. On one hand, it is easy to relate this to Newton's first law as no external force acts on the system. On the other hand, the acceleration of the particle is:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a(t) = \frac{2 \pi \alpha}{T} \cos\left(\frac{2 \pi t}{T}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, here is a case where there is no external force but a non-zero acceleration. What causes the particle to accelerate?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Suppose you are driving a car . And suddenly you applied a brake. You will notice you are pulling backwards. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
No force is acting on you, still your body have a non-zero acceleration.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This might be the case, I am thinking.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}mv^2=\frac{1}{2}m*v(t)^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v(t)=v_0+\alpha sin(\frac{2\pi t}{T})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we can plug this into the right side of the above equation to give:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}mv^2=\frac{1}{2}m (v_0^2+\alpha ^2 sin^2(\frac{2\pi t}{T}))"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To find the "action," which I assume means the kinetic energy, you need to integrate "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}mv^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", meaning we need to integrate both sides."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: The upper limit of the left-hand side(LHS) is v0v_0v0​, and the upper limit of the right-hand side(RHS) is TTT.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\int_{0}^{v_0} \frac{1}{2}mv^2 \,dt = \int_{0}^{T} \frac{1}{2}m (v_0^2+\alpha ^2 sin^2(\frac{2\pi t}{T})) \,dt"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The LHS comes out to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m(v-v_0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The RHS comes out to:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{mT(2v_0^2+\alpha ^2)}{4} - \frac{\alpha ^2 m T sin(4 \pi)}{16 \pi}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simplifying this^ gives:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{mT}{4} \left( (2v_0^2 + \alpha ^2) - \frac{\alpha ^2 sin(4 \pi)}{4 \pi} \right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"sin(4 \pi)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so the second term in the above equation will be zero, leaving this:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{mT}{4} (2v_0^2 + \alpha ^2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We also know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so plugging that value into the above equation gives:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_0^2 T + \alpha ^2T/2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So now that we have this, we can see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=2, b=2, c=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", meaning "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c=6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1 Day to 2016 Final Call
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the largest positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that satisﬁes the property: The set of positive integers can be partitioned into "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" subsets "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_{1}, A_{2}, \\ldots ,  A_{k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that for all integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n \\ge 15"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i \\in \\{\\ 1,2, \\ldots, k \\}\\ "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", there exist two distinct elements of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A_{i}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" whose sum is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" I = \displaystyle \int_{\frac{-\pi}{2}}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \dfrac{\cos x}{1+e^{x}} dx "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" I =\displaystyle \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}}\dfrac{\cos x}{1+e^{x}} +\dfrac{\cos x}{1+e^{-x}} dx = \displaystyle \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \cos x dx "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"     "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" I = \displaystyle \left[ \sin x \right]_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} = 1 - 0 = 1 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: -1 divisibilty problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{The Positive Integers A and B Which}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \frac{A}{B}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A-1}{B-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A-2}{B-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{give an integer}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{A}\neq{B} \neq{(1,2,3) }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For example","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" :  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{9}{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{gives integer and}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{9-1}{3-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{also gives integer}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{and this only 2 fractions}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{The Question Is}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{What is the smallest 2 integers which}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A}{B}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A-1}{B-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A-2}{B-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"text","text":"(3 Fractions)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{gives integer?}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{A}\neq{B} \neq{(1,2,3) }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textit{The awnser is the Sum of {A,B}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"      "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{X^{n}-1}{X^{m}-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Integer, "},{"type":"text","text":"When","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{n}{m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Integer"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Also","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{X^n} {X^m} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X^{n-m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" an integer"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}-2}{2^{x^{m}}-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2×(2^{X^{n}-1}-1)}{2×(2^{x^{m}-1}-1)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}-1}-1}{2^{x^{m}-1}-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\longrightarrow"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Because it is same to equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we can apply the same rule which "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}-2}{2^{x^{m}}-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}-1}-1}{2^{x^{m}-1}-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"An integer  "},{"type":"text","text":"When","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{X^n-1}{X^m-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Integer"}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we know that { "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}-2}{2^{x^{m}}-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}-1}{2^{x^{m}}-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}}{2^{x^{m}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"} "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"integer  when  {"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{x^n}{x^m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{x^n-1}{x^m-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" } "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" integer"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{x^n}{x^m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{x^n-1}{x^m-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" } "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" integer  when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{n} {m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"integer"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" So  { "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}-2}{2^{x^{m}}-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}-1}{2^{x^{m}}-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2^{X^{n}}}{2^{x^{m}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"} "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" integer, when  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{n} {m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"integer"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{So} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" { "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{X^n} , 2^{X^m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" } =(A,B) When "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{n} {m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" =integer"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let X be the smallest integer we can choose"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"When X=1, The 2 numbers will be = 2 and A "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\neq"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" B"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{X=2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And n "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\neq"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"m because A"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\neq"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"B
So the smallest possible 2 integers which not equal and when dividing them they gives an integer is (2,1) "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{   (n, m) =(2, 1)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And by putting X, n, m in their places"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A, B) = ( "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{X^n} , 2^{X^m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") = ( "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{2^2} , 2^{2^1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") = (16,4)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{(A, B) =(4, 16)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And by sum A and B = 20"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1-D Kinematics
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A particle experiences a constant acceleration for 20 seconds after starting from rest. If it travels a distance ‘X’ in first 10 seconds and a distance ‘Y’ in the next 10 seconds, then the relation b.w ‘X’ and ‘Y’is-"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Can use basic kinematics equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \Delta x = v_0 t + \frac{1}{2} a t^2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From position 0 to position X+Y in 20 seconds:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{array}{c}
(X+Y)-0 = (0)(20) + \frac{1}{2}a(20)^2 = 200a \\
X + Y = 200a \\
\end{array} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From position 0 to X in 10 seconds:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{array}{c}
X-0 = (0)(10) + \frac{1}{2}a(10)^2 = 50a \\
a = \frac{X}{50} \\
\end{array} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{array}{c}
X + Y = 200 \cdot \frac{X}{50} \\
X + Y = 4X \\
Y = 3X \\
\end{array} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1-D Lagrangian Mechanics
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider a simple 1-D system consisting of two identical massive particles (with mass "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":").  One is fixed at the origin, and the other is free to move and is located a distance "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" from the origin."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If each particle only experiences the gravity force from the other particle, the differential equation describing the moving particle's position is:  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Large{m \ddot{x} = \frac{-G m^{2}}{x^{2}}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can derive this expression by formulating the behavior of the system in terms of "},{"type":"text","text":"Lagrangian mechanics","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":". In that case, which part of the Euler equation does the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{m \ddot{x}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" term correspond to?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notes:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  The dot notation denotes time-differentiation.  The term "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"L"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" represents the Lagrangian of the system.  The term "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"G"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the universal gravitational constant."}]}]}
